document.masterDocTitle: The taxonomy of the American Ariadna Audouin (Araneae: Synspermiata: Segestriidae)

subSubSection.paragraph:
Ariadne bösenbergii Keyserling, 1877 : 223
, pl. 7, fig. 7 (♀ lectotype and ♂ lectoparatype from Montevideo [34°53'01"S; 56°10'55"W], Uruguay, Bösenberg leg., deposited in ZMH 58, designated by Beatty (1970) , examined; ♂ type from Uruguay, deposited in NHM 90.7.1.475-6-7, examined).

Ariadna mollis—
Mello-Leitão (1933 : 12, Syn. with
A. boesenbergi
; 1947: 234).— Bonnet (1955: 730, 735) .

Ariadna boesenbergi—
Beatty (1970: 476, remove the syn. with
A. mollis
, descr. ♀ )
.— Prandi (1990: 3) .— Grismado (2008: 357, figs 8N, O, 10E, H) .— Ramírez (2014: 211, figs 139A, 141D, 167A) .— Grismado & Izquierdo (2014 : 154, figs 8, 10a‒b, 12).— World Spider Catalog (2018) .

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 22.
Ariadna boesenbergi Keyserling, 1877
. Male from Reserva Biológica São Donato (IBSP 166778) (A‒E): Habitus, dorsal (A) and ventral view (B); left leg I, prolateral view (C) and retrolateral view (D); left metatarsi I, ventral view (E). Female from Parque Natural INIA Las Brujas (IBSP 166779) (F‒J): habitus, dorsal (F) and ventral view (G); epigastric furrow (H), arrowheads = ventral anterior sigillae; right leg I, prolateral (I) and retrolateral view (J). Scale bar: 1mm.

FIGURE 23.
Ariadna boesenbergi Keyserling, 1877
. Male from Reserva Biológica São Donato (IBSP 166778) (A‒B): left palp, prolateral (A) and retrolateral view (B). Female from Buceo (MNHNU 656) (C‒D): Internal genitalia, lateral view (C); Anterior receptaculum, ventral view (D). Scale bar: 1mm.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Diagnosis.
Ariadna boesenbergi
is similar to
A. crassipalpa
,
A. mollis
,
A. calilegua
,
A. changellkuk , A. levii
and
A. perkinsi
due to the dark abdominal pattern with arrow-shaped marks ( Figs 1A‒C , 18A, F , 20A, F , 22A, F , 31A, E , 45A, F , 47A, F , 50A, F ), but differ, except
A. changellkuk
, by the presence of males with metatarsi I straight, without modified macrosetae ( Fig. 22C‒E ); it differs from
A. changellkuk
by having a less elongated body ( Fig. 22A‒B ) and a more elongated mid-portion and embolus ( Fig. 23A‒B ); females are distinguished by the presence of a unillobulated anterior receptaculum, flattened laterally ( Fig. 23C‒D ).

Variation. Male (n=10): Total length 5.12‒7.04; carapace 2.92‒3.52 long, 2.0‒2.48 wide; femur I 2.44‒3.4. Female (n=10): Total length 8.72‒11.64; carapace 3.84‒4.88 long, 2.44‒3.08 wide; femur I 2.64‒3.4.
Distribution. South of Brazil , Uruguay , and center and east of Argentina ( Fig. 70 ).
